title: The Anti-outage Script
description: Never push to production on Friday after 5pm

panels.alt: SPEAKER STANDING ON STAGE: The amount of outages per year has dropped by 60% after we added a simple script to GitHub Pull Request checks
SPEAKER STANDING ON STAGE: And here's it's code
SCRIPT THAT EXITS WITH A NON-ZERO EXIT CODE IF TODAY IS FRIDAY AND IT'S AFTER 5PM

title: If music services suggested food
description: That's why Microsoft Groove is dead

panels.alt: SPOTIFY: You like seafood and tacos, so try a shrimp taco
APPLE MUSIC: Try pizza. Most people like it, you will like it too.
MICROSOFT GROOVE: You like chocolate, that means you like brown, so here's some shit

title: The doorbell
description: This comic is a remake of XKCD's "I'm an idiot" based on my experience.

panels.alt: One day I came back from school and couldn't unlock the door with my key.
At first, I assumed that my parents were home, so I rang the doorbell, but no one heard it
Then I asked my Google Home to yell 'Let me in', but no one heard it, again
My final resort was to VNC into my home Mac server, AirPlay it to my Apple TV and make it yell 'Let me in'
After that, I decided to check 'Find my Friends'. My parents were not home
I found out that I tried to unlock the door with the wrong key.

title: Hardware bugs
description: True story: I once spent 3 hours looking for a software bug when actually I had the wrong resistor connected to a button

panels.alt: Hmm... ON SCREEN OF AN ARDUINO: TEMPERATURE 255 DEGREES CELSIUS
5 HOURS LATER: I connected the sensor to the wrong pin!
When making Arduino projects, I often forget, that in addition to software bugs, there are hardware bugs.
